subtitleNullable: Data Scrapped from VGChartz.com on March 2024.
descriptionNullable:
This dataset is part of a Tableau project designed to show the history of console gaming. 

[https://public.tableau.com/app/profile/lucas.galanti/viz/EvolutionofHomeConsoleGaming/Publicar](url)
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13082573%2F0017985dd7493f39604b48960a98d4d8%2Fgame.PNG?generation=1712663504929410&alt=media)
I do not own any of the data provided. All data were scrapped from VGChartz.com, which is the best source on the internet for data on console and gaming sales.

Important: Even though the data was scrapped on March/2024, data on PS5 and XBoxSeries games are elusive. Maybe because the cross-generation scenario we have right now. I do not suggest using data on the games for these consoles.

There are two csv files in this dataset, with the column description as follows:

## **Console_Data.csv**

- **Console Name:** The market name for the console released
- **Type**: In this dataset all the consoles are "Home", but look into the scrape repository if you want to get data on Handheld consoles as well
- **Company**: Company responsible for the release of the console (Nintendo, Sony, etc)
- **Gen**: Of which generation of consoles the console is a part of
- **Gen Years**: Used for my tableau visual, indicates the period in which each generation takes place
- **Release Year/Discontinuation Year**: Indicates the period of sales for the console
- **Units Sold (million)**: How many units of the console were sold
- **Remarks**: Some additional info on the console

##scrapped_data.csv
- **Game Name:** The market name for the game
- **System Full**: Name of the system in which the game was relased for (relates to the "Console Name" colum on the Console_Data.csv column)
- **Units Sold (million)**: How many units of the game were sold
- **Publisher/Developer**: Pretty self-explanatory
- **Img_URL**: VGChartz has a solid collection of boxarts for the games in its database, the URL link can be used in tableau projects like mine to retrieve the image.
- **Release Date**: Date in which the game was launched in the system
title: Home Consoles and Gaming Sales
subtitle: Data Scrapped from VGChartz.com on March 2024.
